title: The Boat
description: Andy has one last chance to captain the family boat before he sells it, Jim, Pam, and Nellie prank Dwight with a radio interview, and Kevin finds out about Oscar's affair with Angela's husband.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [to camera crew] Can you guys come with me for a minute?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I know you saw me with the Senator. I think I'm in love, possibly for the first time. So yes, Senator Lipton and I are having an affair.  I hope that I can count on your sensitivity, maturity and discretion. [turns to see Kevin has overheard him]...Why?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright, good. Yeah. Just sell it and get the best price you can, okay?

quotes.speaker: White
quotes.text: Or we can hope for a holiday rally?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: White, I'm not a day trader, I'm just a first responder in a disaster.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Andy's family had a total meltdown.  His dad blew through all their money and took off to Argentina with a younger woman.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And his brother, Walt Jr., locked himself in the wine cellar.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The weirdest part is Andy. The aftermath got dumped on him and the way he's been handling it is just..so..

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Competent.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are the 'Nard's hurting? Yeah, you bet. Got kicked pretty hard. Family shattered, super sad. But, I'm kinda crushing it in the damage control department. So, that's cool. I wish my dad could see me now. Of course he caused this whole mess, so, [bleep] him.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Kevin, listen to me. I'm in love with the Senator. And I need time to sort this out in a responsible matter so I need your help in keeping it a secret because this means the world to me. Ok?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That's beautiful. No, I totally get that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Can you do this, Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I really want to. Whatever happens, always remember that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't know what that means. Hey, hey-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [On phone] Oh, great! Yeah, um, I'll get right back to you. [hangs up] Hey guys! Anyone ever heard of Iris Black on the radio?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Yeah, she hosts the Dr. Laura Show.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nope, that's Dr. Laura. Well, her show Biz Whiz wants someone from Dunder Mifflin to come on the air today. Does anybody feel particularly passionate about local business issues? [Dwight raises hand]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I do! I do. I do. I do. I do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The media can make you famous. And do you have any idea how easy it is to sell something when you're famous? [Pretends to be on phone] "Uh, yeah wow. 10 reams of 40 pound bond at only $690 after discount? Um, whatever you say, Brad Pitt." It's that easy.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, so that good looking single brother of yours? Heard he's on a downward spiral with booze.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. He's in rehab actually.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Which place? The one right near Philly? I could be there in an hour.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, it's in New Mexico.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oh...So..- how are you holding up?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We're done Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [wagging tongue for voice exercises] blah blah blah, rat tat tat tittle tattled and prattled on about the little metal bottle, she spat a bit of spittle...[Group protests]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...In a bitter battle..Hey, hey! Stop questioning my methods, OK? I was chosen for this task for a very good reason.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, you chose yourself.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [walking away] Tricky siskel spat a bit of wicked biscuit....

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright, guys. A lot of assets here that my dad couldn't steal.  Now, first of all, there is the family boat. 43 foot Tartan Sloop. My lawyer has lined up a buyer in the Bahamas, the sale would cover the cost of a condo and living expenses for my mom.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Sounds great.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Totally, except it is a no go. This boat was the heart and soul of the family. So...what else we got? Non-boat ideas. [Oscar looks outside conference room at Kevin and Angela at the copier]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What happened?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Jammed. This day couldn't get worse. [Kevin laughs]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, I think this day could get worse.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Kevin!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [to Angela] I don't know what you're talking about. [Thumbs up Oscar]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: She could get like sixty packages of Ramen noodles for five bucks. She could eat for a month.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright, what's the grand total? Did we make our nut?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: If we sell everything but the boat, your mom should be set for about six months.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Guys, you don't understand, this boat's been in our family since before I was born.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Don't you guys have that place where you used to spend your summers and have all those memories?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I worked at a Jiffy Lube.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: See? I bet you wouldn't sell that Jiffy Lube for all the money in the world. Would you Darryl?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I would if I owned it and I went broke.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright, uh...alright. I'm gonna tell the lawyer to pull the trigger on the boat.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes the boat means everything to my family, but we need the money. Got the memories, don't need the boat. Can't cry about it.  What are you gonna do? Cry about it? [chokes up] Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [On phone] Oh, OK. No problem. Thanks. Hey guys, WPTU called.  The interview's off. They're opening a new cupcake store at the Steamtown Mall and Iris wants to cover that, so...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well why don't I go and tell Dwight so he can stop being such a complete nipple.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He's gonna be disappointed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes. He is. And you know what? We cannot let that happen.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Fax?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh yeah, just. Watermelon teeth. This isn't how I would cheer up just anyone. But, it's a girlfriend's job to know her man and I know Andy. [laughs] He's seriously juvenile.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Cool. He's like 40 though, right?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh no, he couldn't be more than late thirty's. Tops.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Awesome. Have fun.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Vroom! Dunder Mifflin. Dunder Mifflin. Good. Sounds- [phone rings in break room, Dwight picks up] This is Dwight Shrute.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on other end in conference room] Please hold for Ms. Black.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [Darryl plays radio show music on keyboard] And welcome back to Biz Whiz. I'm Iris Black. On the line we have Dunder Mifflin's senior sales associate Dwight Shrute.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Iris, thank you so much for having me.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [muffled by watermelon teeth] Hey! My teeth are all this stuff in my mouth. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, did you need something?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, I just need your signature on this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok. [signs paper] thanks.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kevin, we're out of 11-38 forms. Did you order more?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I... did not.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't know why I'm surprised. Literally nothing you do could surprise me anymore.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [laughing in Oscar's direction] Oh really, Angela? That's interesting. Cause I do think that I could surprise you. I think that I could surprise you..oh! [Oscar makes sound trying to get him to shut up] I have to go to the bathroom!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That doesn't surprise me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That actually wasn't the worst cover. I'd say at least once a week, Kevin runs out of the room shouting that he has to go to the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [In staff meeting] See these forms...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I have to go to the bathroom! [runs out]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [running from elevator] I have to go to the bathroom!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Drives away waving, then screeches to a stop and runs from car]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ok, who wants to go for a super fun lunch with a super fun girlfriend?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Look, it's not that I don't want-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ok, come on. I got someone to cover the phones, I heard on the radio about a new cupcake place we could go for dessert...perfect.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All I ever wanted to do was sail the damn thing. But dad wouldn't let me. Said "You can't be a skipper until you're a man." You know, I'd reach for the wheel and he'd smack my hand away. Well guess what? Now I'm the man of the family and... we're selling the damn thing. So I'm never gonna have the chance.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, when does the boat leave, exactly?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tonight.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Then screw lunch. Let's go for a sunset sail.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah right. It's in Stamford, Connecticut. We have to leave like right now.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ok, well then let's leave like right now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, ok.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah! OK! Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Seriously?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Of course, seriously. Get your coat on.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Let's do it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [On speakerphone] Iris, let me tell you. David Wallace is the CEO, but he's not hands on.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [As Iris] So the day-to-day operations are entirely under your command?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Entirely is the perfect way to describe it, Iris.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Uh, excuse me. [reading card held up by Jim] I'm being told by my sound engineer, Steve that uh there is a clinking sound coming from your end. Does your shirt have buttons?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes..?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [Jim mimes taking shirt off] I'm so sorry we're going to have to ask you to remove the shirt all together.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Takes shirt off] Now then, we were saying.  When my workers-gather-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, I'm so sorry. I am told we are still having problems Mr. Shrute. [Jim holds up card that says "Now Pants"] Your voice, it's sounding a little feminine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's impossible.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Are you by any chance wearing pants with a metallic zipper?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: The Senator is exhausted. This campaign is wearing him out.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's a tough one.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That man he's up against is so dirty. And the senator's just pushing back as hard as he can.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Please, stop.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Please, stop.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Anyways, last night he was tired and just wanted a little Mexican brought in. [Kevin laughs]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Getting up to leave] I can't, it's too much! [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm in big trouble.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, Oscar's in big trouble.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [pantless] OK, how is my voice now?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I'm getting the all clear from Steve, so Mr. Shrute, what is your response to the consumer product safety commission that says Dunder Mifflin paper is toxic?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [holding hand over phone] This is gotcha journalism. You know what? They're not gonna gotch me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [looking at folder he brought Toby]It's clearly not an accounting mistake.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: So...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Kevin.  His gambling problem must've resurfaced. I'm gonna have to send him home until I can do an investigation.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well, you've gotta do what you've gotta do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is slander, Ms. Black. Slander I say! [Pam tells Jim to leave the conference room] I dare you to produce one credible source about this.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, as it happens we have with us the foreman of your upstate New York paper mill, Sandra Mc...Sandra Mick [points to Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [changing voice] Good afternoon Iris, it's a pleasure.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Let's get straight to the point. Is your paper toxic?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No the paper's not toxic.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you Sandra!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Unless it's exposed to oxygen. Then it becomes extremely toxic!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do not listen to her! This employee is obviously disgruntled! [Jim runs panicked into break room]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What the heck is going on?! The stock prices are plummeting! Are you gonna take control of the message or do I have to send in someone who understands the media?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Get out of here moron! [Jim leaves]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Excuse me, Mr. Dwight, who are you talking to?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: uhhhh....no one.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Did you just call Ms. Mick a moron?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, everything's fine.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Are you insulting my guests?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [chokes up]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [on phone] Yeah, I will be right there. Hey Oscar, what if I'm getting a promotion?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I hope that's it, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Me too. Cause then, I would get my own office. And I wouldn't screw up your secret with Angela. I've been really worried about that.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hi, Kevin. Look, I need to talk to you about-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Guys? Excuse me. Um, a quick word, please just..

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oscar, we're in the middle of talking.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh, you're right I'm so sorry. Snack machine on me. [gives Kevin money]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh that is nice. Classy move. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [yelling in break room] That's what I'm saying! No of course not!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Those figures I gave you? They're false.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: How?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I was mad at Kevin, we had a fight and I acted vindictively.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: So you set him up.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes, he's innocent.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I knew it. I knew it from the beginning it was possible.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What are you talking about? I just did this now.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: A few years ago, when I was on the jury of the Scranton Strangler..

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I always thought he might have been set up but I felt pressured to convict.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's gotta be tough.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Tough? I put an innocent man on death row.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: The fallout from this morning's revelation continues to mount, since Mr. Dwight Shrute began speaking, Dunder Mifflin share prices fell 73%.  Mr. Shrute, shareholders demand accountability from corporate leadership. Can we announce your resignation at this time?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My resignation? What are you talking about? No! I was just following orders! Listen, the person responsible for this catastrophe is the CEO and chairman, David Wallace!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: That's yours?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's the family boat!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh my gosh, Andy! This is enormous!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Right?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I thought it was gonna be tiny. Oh my gosh it's beautiful. So this is how your family came to America.

quotes.speaker: Boat Guy
quotes.text: Move.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sorry?

quotes.speaker: Boat Guy
quotes.text: Trying to rig a boat here.  I don't know how to do that when you're standing in the way.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sure, I um..I didn't know.

quotes.speaker: Boat Guy
quotes.text: I'm not a ghost, so I can't walk through people.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Gee, he was salty.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Geez, a little bit. [to boat] How you doing old buddy? Missed you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What does that one do?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It raises the main sail. That was my job when we went sailing.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I wish I had seen you do it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Begins raising sail] Up she goes!

quotes.speaker: Boat Guy
quotes.text: Don't do that. Don't do that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, it's OK. My girlfriend and I were actually gonna take her for a little spin and a picnic before you guys head out tonight. You know what? Get some dinner on me.

quotes.speaker: Boat Guy
quotes.text: Nope. Can't do that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You got it. You know what then, we'll just take it for a quick little spin around the harbor. [begins raising sail, boat guy slaps his hand]

quotes.speaker: Boat Guy
quotes.text: We've already started boarding. And no one is insured to rig her up right now except us.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know what? Chill, ok? I own the boat. Not gonna sue myself. Alright, so just- [Raises sail, guys slaps hand again] wow.

quotes.speaker: Boat Guy
quotes.text: I can smack you all day if you keep touching what you're not supposed to touch.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok, fine.

quotes.speaker: Boat Guy
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, fine.

quotes.speaker: Boat Guy
quotes.text: Good stuff.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Good stuff. Nice stuff. [begins raising sail again when guy leaves, but he comes back and smacks Andy's hand again] [bleep] Damn it! Screw you dad! ..ah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, we're doing it. We're finally having a picnic on the boat.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I've had a thousand picnics on this boat. The point was for me to sail it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy, you never had to sail the boat to be a man.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fine. But I could have.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: As long as we're on this boat, as far as I'm concerned, you're the captain.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am the captain.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Right?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm the captain. [to boat guy] Hey, charm school.

quotes.speaker: Boat Guy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm taking it over from here.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Nice!

quotes.speaker: Boat Guy
quotes.text: I hate to uh, ruin this moment...or breakdown, but you already signed the papers. So, if you want your boat back, you can pick it up there in the Bahamas in 10 days.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, I know cause I'm sailing it there.

quotes.speaker: Boat Guy
quotes.text: OK, no. I already said, you're not getting back your deposit.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fine. Good. Keep it. Just leave the supplies, I paid for those. But how much for that cool fisherman sweater?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: For those just joining us, terror in Greenwich.  Where police have surrounded the house of Dunder Mifflin CEO David Wallace. Wallace is said to be despondent over the company's stock plummet and is taking a mailman hostage. On the line, we have chief of Greenwich Police, Mr. Bill Jackson [points to Jim].

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [using black voice] Good afternoon! [Darryl smacks his arm]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please sir! Spare him. Please.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, this Wallace guy is lookin' at hard time. And we only know this because of what Dwight Snoot said on record!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, everyone. Everyone, hold on! I've got a solution. I know Wallace's phone number, everyone hold, I'll conference him in.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, Mr. Shrute, there's really no need to, um involve Mr... Wallace.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Do you even know what you're doing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah I know how to hoist the mail sail, I know to...I, I, these buttons control boat pumps and stuff. I also know where the booze stash is. So, hello.  [Opens door, Andy's brother is passed out inside] Walt?

quotes.speaker: Walter Jr.
quotes.text: Oh god, thank goodness you're here. I was having a little trouble with this door. Yesterday. I um, I think it was yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I thought you were in rehab.

quotes.speaker: Walter Jr.
quotes.text: Yeah, uh, I just, I figured I'd get that first relapse out of the way. God, what's happened to our family? Everything is so messed up! How did you even know I was in here?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I didn't.  I, I just came to say goodbye to the boat.  But I've decided to sail it to Bermuda.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Bahamas, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Same thing. [To Walt] Come on. I need a crew. You should be my crew. Three weeks, open ocean, no booze. You need this. I need it, we need this. Serious bro time, come on.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [On phone] Hello?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: David, is that you?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, thank god. Oh, thank god. Are you ok? Is everyone ok?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah? Are you ok?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, I'm OK.  I just want you to know that I believe in you. I really do. And I believe in your ability to make the right choices. I always have, David.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Well, thanks Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're welcome, sir. But David, listen to me carefully. I'm gonna need you to let the mailman go. Ok?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Walk out of the house...

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...with your hands on top of your head, everything is going to be fine. Dunder Mifflin will be in good hands while you're away in prison.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Ok, Dwight, gonna ask you to not call my cell anymore. Gotta go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [enters main office, group claps] Wait a minute, you guys? You heard?

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Shrute! Shrute! Shrute!Shrute! Shrute! Shrute! Shrute! Shrute!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [joins in] Shrute! Shrute!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Overall, I'd say my first radio interview went pretty much the way I expected.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well Oscar, I did not get the promotion. He just wanted to update my personal information.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well, I am sorry Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Why on earth would you think you were getting a promotion?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You know what Angela? I- Oh my god. [Senator enters]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Honey! What are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: I just had a little intuition that someone I loved needed a little bit of attention today. Oscar, you're looking very healthy. Getting lots of vigorous exercise? [touches Oscar's shoulder. Oscar jumps away quickly]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oscar? What is going on? What was that?

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: What was that? I'm sorry, I didn't mean any offense. I was just trying to be friendly.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You know what? I'm sorry. I overreacted. Because I'm stressed out. Why am I stressed out? Who's not stressed out? Who's not stressed out? Who-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Come on Oscar, we're not just gonna sit here and ignore the obvious. Senator Lipton has a big election next week. We all need to give him our support. [claps, group joins]

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Well, thanks everybody.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It is really cool! U-S-A! U-S-A!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: U..s..a. U-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I have to say I'm impressed with Kevin. Uh, he showed a lot of self-control.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I totally forgot about the affair for a minute. [laughs] Oscar is having sex with the senator and Angela doesn't even know. [laughing still] Her life is a complete sham!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright guys, cast us off. Walt, all aboard! Erin, this is because of you.  Do you realize that? You're the best ever!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [Standing on dock] Oh, you know. Just being a good girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [pulling away from dock] Good? Come on. Above and beyond. World's Greatest. You did this! Dammit I'm happy!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes, I am very pleased I did help Andy. Would I have gone with him if he'd asked me? On his sailboat cruise to the Caribbean? Yes. I think it would have been really fun and romantic.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [waving from boat] I'll see you in three weeks!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: OK!

quotes.speaker: Walter Jr.
quotes.text: Hey bro! It was here all along. [holding guitar]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No way!

quotes.speaker: Walter Jr.
quotes.text: Way!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Erin I gotta go![Walt begins playing] Them's my chords!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Hey. She's back.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thanks for covering the phones.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah, no problem. How was it?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Hey, some buddies of mine are going to Poor Richard's for beers and pool, you wanna come? I can't promise you too much, but uh, you might get to meet my friend flipper.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Does he have a flipper?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Oh. Nope. It's not that, he uh, uh he flipped a table one time when he was drunk.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He sounds like an idiot.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah, he is.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah.
